page.title: 10FARMING (cont.,4th page)
page.content: {SOUTH LEE FARM }cont from p9....... It is a contract farm which means that they hire out machinery and workers to other farms,but only when they are not needed at South Lee. This means that farmers can hire instead of having to buy expensive equipment. {ETTIFORD FARM.} In Saxon times this name meant "at the farm". On this farm there is a bronze-age barrow.There is a stream which separates the parish of Berrynarbor and Bittadon. The main crops are cabbages,corn,oats and potatoes.The farmhouse was originally a "devon longhouse",there are ship timbers in the house and barns with studs to hold them together.There are sheep and cows on this farm.
